verses.verse: To the messenger of the congregation of Ephesus write: He who holds the seven stars in his right hand and walks among the seven golden candlesticks says,
"I know your actions, your labor, your patience, and how you cannot tolerate those who are evil. You have examined those who say they are apostles but are not and found them to be fakes.
"You have endured and been constant, and for my name's sake you have labored and haven't wore out.
"Nevertheless I have [something] against you, because you have forsaken your first love.
"Now remember from where you have fallen from, repent, and do the first works now, or else I will come to you quickly and will remove your candlestick from its place, unless you repent.
"But you do have this: that you hate the deeds of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.
"Everyone having ears, listen now to what the Spirit is saying to the congregations. To him who overcomes I will allow to eat from the tree of life which is in the midst of God's paradise.
"To the messenger of the congregation in Smyrna write: These things says the first and the last which was dead and now is alive.
"I am aware of your actions, hardships, and poverty (but you are rich), and the character assassination by those who say they are Jews (they are not), instead they are the synagogue of Satan.

"Do not fear any of those things which you suffer. Be fully aware, the devil will throw [some] of you into prison so you can be tempted, and you will be cruelly treated ten days. Be faithful even to death, and I will give you a crown of life.
"Everyone having ears, listen to what the Spirit is saying to the congregations. He who overcomes will not be hurt by the second death".
"To the messenger of the congregation in Pergamos write: These things says he who has the sharp two-edged sword.

"I know your actions and where you live (Satan's throne [is there]), and how you cling to my name and have not denied my faith, even in those days when Antipas, my faithful witness, was killed in your presence, where Satan lives.

"But I have a few things against you, because you have there those who cling to the doctrine of Balaam, who taught Balac to set a trap in front of the children of Israel, to eat things sacrificed to idols, and to commit fornication.
"So also you have those who cling to the doctrine of the Nicolaitans, which thing I hate.
"Repent or else I will come quickly and will fight against them with the sword of my mouth.

"Everyone having ears, let him hear what the Spirit is saying to the congregations. To him who overcomes I will give the hidden manna to eat and a white stone, and on that stone a new name written which no one knows except the one who receives it".
"To the messenger of the congregation of Thyatira write: These things says the Son of God, who has his eyes like flaming fire and his feet like brilliant brass.
"I know your actions, love, service, faith, patience, and again, your latest works are greater than the first.

"Nevertheless, I have a few things against you, because you allow that woman, Jezebel, who calls herself a prophetess, to teach and seduce my servants to commit fornication and to eat things sacrificed to idols.
"I gave her time to repent of her fornication, but she did not repent.
"Watch, I will throw her into a bed along with those who commit adultery with her into great suffering unless they repent of their works.

"I will kill her children with death, then all the congregations will know that I am he who searches the innermost desires and innermost thoughts. I will give to everyone of you according to your works.
"But I speak to you and to the rest in Thyatira who do not have this teaching and who have not learned the depths of Satan, as they put it. I will lay no other burden on you.
"But those things that you do have, hold on to [them] until I come.
"I will give authority over the nations to him who overcomes and keeps my works to the end.
"He will rule them with a rod of iron; like clay pots they will be shattered, just as I received from my Father.
"I will give him the morning star.
"Everyone having ears, let him hear what the Spirit is saying to the congregations".
